page.title: 06ECOLOGY IN EYKE PARISH
page.content:
Staverton Park is ancient woodland with oak, holly and some birch trees. It contains the tallest holly tree in Britain. Many oaks are pollarded, and are unusually shaped. The deer park is estimated to be 600 years old.
Aldewood Forest is managed by the Forestry Commission. These are coniferous and a few diciduous trees, with more of the latter being planted. First plantations were after World War One, prior to which this was heathland. It is now the home of fallow deer and decreasing numbers of red squirrels since the grey arrived in 1974.
Eyke Parish takes part in a Council organised tree planting scheme, and has planted birches on the Recreation Ground boundary.
